name: NBCNews
text:
On Ep. 27 of #IntoAmerica: Activists are putting pressure on cities to reallocate police budgets to communities of color. LA is taking steps to make that a reality. 

.@trymainelee looks at what led to the decision and if it goes far enough. 

Listen now: https://t.co/8ya99AFhFr https://t.co/BgMHXu0tkP

name: NBCNews
text: The Oscars announces films will be required to meet "representation and inclusion standards" to qualify for awards beginning next year. https://t.co/gxjFByfs33

name: NBCNews
text: Opinion | David Smith: NASCAR knows it’s only as inclusive as its fan base. Banning the Confederate flag is designed to uproot its most obvious foundational problem to usher in a brighter future. https://t.co/ZTrKeRRlwb - @NBCNewsTHINK

name: NBCNews
text: Human remains found on the property of Lori Vallow's husband Chad Daybell belong to her 2 children, Tylee Ryan and Joshua Vallow, Idaho authorities confirm. https://t.co/QlpDxH4Iv5

text: US Customs and Border Protection spent portions of a $112M emergency fund meant to buy food, medicine, and other items for migrants on ATVS, dirt bikes, and boats, according to a Government Accountability Office report. https://t.co/a7Nodf09e0

text: While parts of Berlin’s economy are starting to emerge from the lockdown, the country’s vibrant club scene is facing perhaps the biggest challenge in its history, with no clear answers on when it might resume. https://t.co/bnBCNApXvF

text: How Bruce Lee became a symbol of solidarity with the Black community. https://t.co/tmJdJLQAmi - @NBCAsianAmerica

name: NBCNews
text: Former ‘SNL’ cast member Jay Pharoah says he was stopped and handcuffed by Los Angeles police in February, with one officer kneeling on the actor's neck in a similar fashion to what occurred in the deadly arrest of George Floyd in Minneapolis last month. https://t.co/iDJ4KgDL4r

name: NBCNews
text: Family of Layleen Polanco, a transgender woman who died last June in a Rikers Island jail cell, says surveillance camera footage shows that Rikers staff failed to provide her with medical care that could have saved her life. https://t.co/JgS0kmdJ5L

name: NBCNews
text: Award-winning journalist @trymainelee has covered racial injustice his entire career. He’s also lived it. Get his take on the current moment as the host of #IntoAmerica. Listen to the special collection “Into an American Uprising” on @Spotify. https://t.co/rpUGOcuBfT https://t.co/C3nIkJRrX7

name: NBCNews
text: US Secret Service said Saturday that one of their agents used pepper spray to clear protesters from Lafayette Square ahead of President Trump’s photo op, reversing an earlier statement claiming that no one from the agency had done so. https://t.co/cRW1Vl5rhL

text: A woman from Tacoma, Washington, accused of setting fire to 5 Seattle police cars during protests late last month, has been arrested. https://t.co/t9eBqUOzNy
